title: Issue #2 - August 8, 2011 - YAPC::EU is coming!
header: Welcome to the second issue of the Perl Weekly. The number of subscribers grew a lot more than I expected. Thank you for your confidence! I hope I can fulfill your expectations.
Next week I am going to be at YAPC::EU in Riga. If you happen to be there too, please say hello!

entries.title: Nitty Gritty Details From YAPC::Asia by Daisuke Maki (lestrrat)
entries.text: YAPC::Asia is the biggest Perl event in the world with more than 500 visitors. The organizers are looking for more talks and sponsors. This post has a few links for previous talks and it also explins the finances behind YAPC::Aisa and JPA. BTW since then there was another post telling us that tickets are already on sale.

entries.title: 19th edition of the German Perl-Magazine was published
entries.text: Renee Baecker writes that the latest edition of the Perl-Magazin (in German) was published. The content includes Moose tutorial, 2D gameprogramming with OpenGL, Roles with Role::Basic, WxPerl Tutorial, Data Serialization, Linked objects in OTRS and Perl 6 overview.

entries.title: European speaking schedule of Damian Conway
entries.text: If you happen to be in or near Lisbon, Oslo, Lausanne, Zurich or Riga in the next few weeks you are lucky as Damian Conway comes to your city. In some places he gives free talks while in others he provides public training classes. I am going to attend one of his classes in Riga

entries.title: 8 Random password generators in Perl
entries.text: NeilB from Cogendo gave a thorough analysis of the 8 random password generators he found on CPAN. Do you know others he has not mentioned?

entries.title: OSDC.fr - French Open Source Developers' Conference
YAPC::Asia
entries.text: October 13-15, 2011, Tokyo, Japan - In the previous issue I missed this one. Sorry.
